backgroundInformationList.description: Notice of Proposal - To pass a By-law to permanently close parts of public highways in the Etobicoke York Community Council Area - Kipling Avenue, Dundas Avenue West, and Bloor Avenue West

noticeDescription:
CITY OF TORONTO ACT, 2006, PUBLIC NOTICE

 

Etobicoke York Community Council Area

 

The Council of the City of Toronto proposes to pass a by-law to permanently close the following:

 

 

1. Part of the public highway known as Kipling Avenue, legally described as follows:

 

PART OF PIN 07536-0222 (LT)
Part of Lots 77, 78,79 on Plan 1602, designated as Part 2 on 66R-31546, Etobicoke, City of Toronto

 

2. Part of the public highway known as Dundas Avenue West, legally described as follows:

 

PART OF PIN 07536-0227 (LT)
Part of Lot 80 on Plan 1602 and Part of Lot 7 Concession A Clergy Block, designated as Part 3 on 66R-31546, Etobicoke, City of Toronto

 

3. Part of the public highway known as Bloor Avenue West, legally described as follows:

 

PART OF PIN 07300-0043 (LT)
Part of Bloor Street West, Road Allowance between Lot 15 on First Meridian Concession and Lot 7 Concession A Clergy Block, designated as Part 4 on 66R-31546, Etobicoke, City of Toronto

 

4. Part of the public highway known as Kipling Avenue, legally described as follows:

PART OF PIN 07533-0027 (LT)
Part of Lots 24, 25, 30, 31, 32 on Plan 2706, designated as Part 2 on 66R-31318, Etobicoke, City of Toronto

 

5. Part of the public highway known as Dundas Ave West, legally described as follows:

PART OF PIN 07541-0085 (LT)
Part of Lot 23 on Plan 2706 and Part of Block A and Part of Lot 13 on Plan 3408, designated as Part 3 on 66R-31318, Etobicoke, City of Toronto

 

At its meeting to be held in the Council Chamber, Etobicoke Civic Centre, 399 The West Mall on May 13, 2024 at 9:30 a.m., or shortly afterwards, the Etobicoke York Community Council will hear from, or by their counsel, agent or solicitor, any person who wishes to speak to this matter.

 

The meeting of the Etobicoke York Community Council will be held with members participating in person and remotely, and the proceedings of the Etobicoke York Community Council will be conducted publicly.

 

To obtain additional information, including to view a copy of the proposed by-law and plan to close parts of Bloor Street West, Dundas Street West and Kipling Avenue please review Item EY13.9 on the Community Council's agenda at https://secure.toronto.ca/council/#/committees/2464/24453.

 

To submit comments or address the Etobicoke York Community Council meeting on May 13, 2024 either in-person or by video conference or by phone, please contact the City Clerk's Office no later than 12:00 p.m. on May 10, 2024:

 

Administrator, Etobicoke York Community Council
City Clerk's Office
Telephone: 416-397-4579; Fax: 416-392-2980
E-mail: etcc@toronto.ca

Mail: Etobicoke York Community Council
c/o Toronto City Hall, 100 Queen Street West, 2nd Floor
Toronto, Ontario M5H 2N2

 

Special Assistance for Members of the Public: City staff can arrange for special assistance with some advance notice. If you need special assistance, please call 416-397-4579, TTY 416-338-0889 or e-mail etcc@toronto.ca.

 

Notice to people writing or making presentations to the Etobicoke York Community Council: The City of Toronto Act, 2006 and the City of Toronto Municipal Code authorize the City of Toronto to collect any personal information in your communication or presentation to City Council or its committees. The City collects this information to enable it to make informed decisions on the relevant issue(s). If you are submitting letters, faxes, e-mails, presentations or other communications to the City, you should be aware that your name and the fact that you communicated with the City will become part of the public record and will appear on the City’s website. The City will also make your communication and any personal information in it – such as your postal address, telephone number or e-mail address – available to the public, unless you expressly request the City to remove it.

 

Many Committee, Board, and Advisory Body meetings are broadcast live over the internet for the public to view. If you speak at the meeting you will appear in the video broadcast. Video broadcasts are archived and continue to be publicly available.

 

This notice shall also constitute notice to the public of the proposed public highway closure in accordance with the requirements of the Municipal Class Environmental Assessment for Schedule A+ activities.
title: Notice of Proposal - To pass a By-law to permanently close parts of public highways in the Etobicoke York Community Council Area - Kipling Avenue, Dundas Avenue West, and Bloor Avenue West
topics: Transportation > Intention to close or alter a lane, road or highway
